description:
First time here and I loved it.  Broth was delicious and the wheat noodles taste like the regular ones-- a pleasant surprise. Three shrimp for $2.50 is expensive but they were tender and tasty. The mushrooms were a little chewy but delicious. The meal itself was a generous portion.  

Ordering online was easy, convenient can and my order was ready fast. The text telling me my order was ready was great. All in all, a very good experience. I would definitely come here again.
author: Mari C.

description:
My work offered NoodleMe for lunch, so I ordered the Buttercup bowl, and added an egg and some edamame on the side.

We ordered through Caviar so there wasn't the option of customizing a bowl :( and I tried to substitute spinach for the sweet onion mix in the bowl, but ultimately didn't get that.

Cute to-go containers- plastic bowl for the soup and a compostable square bowl with the noodles, veggies, and meat. The xo habanero broth is slightly spicy, a bit salty, but flavorful. Egg noodles were cooked to an al dente texture, and overall a satisfying meal. Online, I read that the edamame had miso and furikake flavor, but I had simple non-flavored edamame (kind of a letdown, but not too disappointed).

Overall, good for a work meal, but not sure if I'd go out of the way to order it myself.
author: Mary F.

description:
OK, the noodles are pretty good. I like the veggie broth and the yummies you get are really tasty...the service is good and it's a good go to place for lunch.

The cons? I dont care what you say, no bowl of ANY noodles should cost more the $10. No matter how I try it is always $14.

For $14 a noodle should be running one of my feet while I am eating.
author: John C.

description:
It was so so.

First off, they got my order wrong!  I asked for flat rice noodles and they gave me thin rice noodles.  I didn't notice until I opened up everything at work :(

Pro:  Pork broth was tasty.  Most ingredients seem fresh.  Nice to-go packaging.  No MSG.  

Con:  The rice noodles need to be fresh, not dried.   For the starter price of $9, it needs to be slurpy fresh noodles.  Proteins are add-on pricing of $2+!  This can be a very expensive meal!

Maybe the location has bad fengshui because when I entered, it was dark, dim and unwelcoming.  I felt the staffs depressed mood.  There was no joy in the air.  

Will I ever come back?  Maybe, maybe not.  I make a better noodle at home.  

Notes:  its actually on Pine Street, not Market Street.  5-6 stools for sit down.  Very small small location.
author: Jenny T.

description: I like the Chipotle of noodle soup concept, and I appreciate how quickly I was able to get my grub, but I was a bit disappointed in the taste of the pork broth. If it were a bit richer and tastier, I would be all over this lunch spot!
author: Tammy K.

description:
For our weekly office lunch, I decided to start with a noodle soup. Our delivery order from NoodleMe arrived on Friday, May 18th around 12:15pm via Caviar.

I ordered the XO Habanero with Egg Noodles: Egg noodles, cabbage, kale, bean sprouts, bamboo, kimchee, XO-habanero flavor, and pork broth ($9). I'm not big on noodles in my soup, so I put those aside and added everything else to the broth. The noodles did resemble wonton mein for anyone wondering what the noodles may be like. The soup had a decent amount of flavor. Though I do like my pork based soups to be meatier. And for a habanero broth, I found it lacking in heat. It wasn't even really spicy at all. The dish did come with a good amount of toppings though.

For people who prefer milder flavors, I think this may fit the bill. But I found their noodle soup to be rather bland. When I see habanero, I need super spicy. This barely had any heat. Okay if you are just craving a somewhat brothy asian soup.
author: Elena N.

description:
Solid place for noodles in FiDi.
Service: 5 stars.

I really like how they have the option for you to build your own noodle bar and customize it, or they have signature dishes you can select where the ingredients are pre-selected. 

Really good broth. I liked my egg noodles--there were a lot of them! I didn't finish it. I really liked my egg. My only complaint is that in the build-your-own, the only protein option (included in the $9-something price) was tofu. I would've loved some of the BBQ pork shoulder my friend got in what she ordered, but I didn't want to pay extra and that's partially my fault but also the noodles are sort-of pricey...

Not sure if it's worth coming back to. I'm not used to paying over $10 for noodles unless it's really good ramen.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
It was another cold day in SF and the temperature felt especially harsh as I had just returned that morning from a weekend of bliss is warm Maui. I tried to stay warm in line as I studied the menu and tried my best to make a concoction that wouldn't suck. 

I chose wheat noodles with sesame tofu, bamboo shoots, and sweet onion mix in a miso pork broth and $2 extra for ground pork. When I was finally done with my options, I discovered that there were premade combinations I could have selected. Since I had already put quite a bit of effort into this, I decided to stick with what I got.

I like the way they package the noodles so that the soup is separate from the rest of the contents and everything is held together with the handle. After getting my order, I headed back upstairs to try it out. Given that each component was cooked separately, it did not surprise me when the flavored seemed to fit together superficially but not meld as well as regular noodle soup.

The overall flavor was not bad and my only regret were the onions that made me have bad breath for the whole next day.
author: Yi Z.

description:
NoodleMe is a hidden gem. For real, this place does not come up when I type "vegan" in on Yelp, so to me it's hidden! Why hidden?!? Hopefully this review changes that: vegan vegan vegan vegan vegan!!!

So I found this place after a doctor appointment when I was walking back to work down a street I never walk down. When I walked past NoodleMe I saw the word "Veganese" on a sign and I perked up like a meerkat!  Veganese? What is that!?

I headed on in (even though I had salad on my mind that day) to investigate and was immediately sold. The owner was super friendly and described the soup in such a way that I could not resist. I ordered my veganese (minus mushrooms) and was handed the cutest take away container and off I went skipping back to work. No, I wasn't really skipping, but inside I was! Hahaha! 

When I arrived at my office and opened my food container it was love at first sight/smell. The soup (filled with rice noodles, cabbage, bean sprouts, bamboo shoots, delicious spicy tofu, in a mushroom broth, peanut and yellow curry) was like heaven. After my first bite I was immediately addicted and told my whole entire office about NoodleMe. And now I'm telling all of you. NoodleMe is amazing, reasonably priced, and offers delicious vegan options. I will be back...often!
author: Christina M.

description:
This place has such horrible customer service - THEY ALWAYS get your order wrong!!!

I just placed an order with uber eats - missing the broth - I called and the woman that works there with dark brown hair - is HORRIBLE!! everytime i would go in, she is rude, doesn't put in your order properly - today she starts giving me a lecture on the phone about how I should act when I call with a compliant...and further goes on to tell me how I should not eat there anymore!!!!!

the first few bowls I had were good - but it's been many times now where they get my order wrong, or the taste isn't good

I highly suggest getting good customer service
author: Erica L.

description:
This was an accidental stumble of mine since it was the week between Christmas and New Year's and most of my regular lunch spots were closed for the week. I came in not knowing what to expect, so went with one of their signature dishes rather than a "build your own". The noodle and soup itself were not bad, and they have a great system for takeout. I recommend the pork over the chicken since the chicken I got was a little bit pink which always freaks me out a little.

Good for a cold day, good for take out, service is decent (they were a little bit slow even for a day that had no line), and not sure what lines are like on a normal work day.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
I liked how I was able to make my own noodle bowl. Each bowl costs $9. Special toppings, such as mushrooms, cost an additional $2. These were the items I added to my bowl:

- Noodles: Egg Noodles
- Vegetables: Fresh Tofu, Wakame Seaweed, Scallions
- Flavor: Miso Sesame
- Broth: Vegetable Stock (vegan)
- Extras: Mushrooms

The employees were generous with the toppings. I saw them scoop a large handful of seaweed. I found the seaweed and scallions to be very fresh. The person who took our order was very nice. He even said bye to us as we walked out. 

I did find my dish to be very salty though. I am not sure if it was from the miso sesame or vegetable stock. The egg noodles may have also contributed to the saltiness. One friend of mine tried some of my dish and also agreed that it was salty. The next time that I come here, I'll see what happens if I get a different type of noodle and flavor. 

The seating area was a little cramped and uncomfortable. There was a large rack blocking our legs, so it was hard to stretch them out.
author: Kristina M.

description:
I did not like the food here at all... maybe I DIY'ed a bad ramen combination but I would probably go to other nearby ramen places instead in the future.

I didn't have that high an expectation going into it since I know this type of quick lunch spots obviously cannot compete with restaurants in Japantown, but still I was disappointed. I was not a fan of their noodles or the broth (the one I got is super bland). Most of my coworkers enjoyed it though so maybe it's just me.

Service-wise this place is very fast. You can also order online, so definitely convenient for all the people working in FiDi. Reasonably priced as well for lunch.
author: Angel C.

description:
Pro tip: Unless you really know what you're doing or have specific tastes, getting the bowls they've suggested are the way to go.

I placed my order online at 12:03pm, and it was ready for me at 12:18pm. I walked past the loooooong line, and my order was ready to go. No waiting!

I got the 5 Times Happiness bowl:
rice noodles, sweet freshly sliced onions, fresh tofu, herb salad with delicious Thai basil, chicken, soft egg, pork broth, lemongrass-ginger. It was packaged to go in a nice carrying case (minimal packaging), with everything in one bowl except the broth. The broth was in a separate container for you to pour over once you're ready to eat it. Everything was great - flavors, temperature, you name it. My only complaint is that while the egg was cooked perfectly, it was on the cold side. Not a big deal, and I wasn't expecting it to be perfect since I wasn't dining in.

Overall a great place! This will be one of my regular lunch spots going forward!
author: Jaching H.

description:
Wow, this place got popular! Perhaps I should take some of the credit for spreading the word :) I hadn't been for awhile, but with the weather turning and suffering a drawn-out two week long cold, noodles and warm broth sounded perfect.  I was surprised when arriving just after noon to see about 15 people past the door. It took 20 minutes until food was in hand; fortunately, they're smart to have people fill out their orders in line so they're not wasting time hemming and hawing at the register. Staff have always been friendly and helpful.

Ordering in advance online is definitely the way to go, especially since there's only a few counter-style seats and the place gets cramped. Sadly, I typically get the Veganese but sub wheat noodles (closer to ramen-style noodles) and there's not a way to do this online. The best reason to order to-go? The super awesome package design of the takeout carrier! Your broth sits on top, separate from the ingredients so they don't get all soggy. They fit snugly in the cardboard wrap holder. On my first walk back I was a little nervous but those containers aren't going anywhere. Every time I get comments wondering where this smart lunch package came from.

Portions are quite large and in range for the price point of ~$12-$15 before tax. I'm always thankful for vegetarian and vegan options, especially when priced lower than the meat options (as they should be!). Ingredients are fresh and the broth is flavorful. I love that for the Veganese, peanut and yellow curry are added to the vegetable broth so it's not too thick and doesn't fatigue.
author: Cristina S.

description: L O V E this place! The best broth I have ever tasted, I prefer the pork broth. Try a signature bowl first, than move on to create your own. Line is normally long, but so worth the wait.
author: Kathy A.

description:
I was super excited to try this place because decent quick/to-go noodle soup options are basically non-existent in FiDi. And today has been windy and chilly, perfect noodle soup weather in my book.

I ordered online after reading the reviews on Yelp. The online ordering process was easy and convenient. But the pick-up experience was quite disappointing, as I waited 26 min after I arrived to get my food, which is already 3 min after the quoted pick-up time. It completely defeats the purpose of quick noodle soup and ordering online, and I think I would've gotten my food faster had I been waiting in the physical line. I do feel that this is just one of those crazy days, based on the Yelp reviews I've read, and there were only 3 people working the noodle assembly line. So I will update my review in the future if that experience changes. But for now, minus one star for that super long wait.

I had the Veggie Delight, with rice noodles, mushrooms, soft boiled egg, corn, tofu, seaweed, green onions, and the XO habanero vegetable broth. The ingredients tasted fresh. I love that they are not stingy about the toppings. There were plenty of mushrooms and corn and tofu and etc. in my bowl. The broth was flavorful and not too spicy. The soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly. But as other Yelpers indicated, the egg was cold like other toppings. The broth was lukewarm as other Yelpers mentioned as well. Towards the end of my bowl, everything was cold, which made me sad. Minus one star for these details.

I like the different options and the ability to customize your own noodle soup bowl. Price is alright for FiDi lunch spot. Shop is small and cramp during lunch hour rush. Best bet is to take it to-go and nuke it for a bit in the microwave at work. I'll be back to try more, and I hope they can work on streamlining their processes a bit to improve their ordering/food assembling experience.
author: Nana L.

description: it was really good, i work in this area so it took me a while to pay over $10 for soup but it was delish and you can customize which is good.  only thing is, it was warm and soup should be hot.  i don't work far from the location so maybe ate it 8 mins after i picked it up.  so i wish it was hotter.  other than that good soup and good service.  i did go before the rush though.
author: Natasha D.

description:
A take-out only shop serving SoMa near Embarcadero, NoodleMe is a convenient place to get some Asian flavors for a light lunch. Their noodle soups come in two parts--a plastic cup for the soup, and a paper bowl for the noodles and toppings; it's all packaged up in a little paper contraption that keeps everything together, and you're also free to help yourself to any sides and sauces as well!

I ordered the 5 Happiness bowl, which came with rice noodles, poached chicken, tofu, a boiled egg, onions, and an herb salad, along with a cup of pork broth. The pork broth was tasty--though it was a little bit reminiscent of the flavors from cup noodles. However, everything else was very bland. The noodles and toppings had simply been boiled and weren't well seasoned at all. Though I understand that you're supposed to choose your own sauces and flavorings, this was just a bit disappointing. The prices here are also not cheap--my bowl was $14 and was a pretty tiny portion. If I went to any other Asian noodle shop anywhere else outside downtown SF, I could definitely get a much better value for my money.
author: David K.

description:
This place is crazy busy during the prime lunch hour. I got the times happiness bowl and added chicken. The chicken was so so salty, not sure if it made my broth also super salty? The broth was also not very hot but I think it was due to the fact it's in to go containers. Although I was pleased they cooked the egg perfectly. 

All in all I would not pay $15for this -_- way overpriced for this food.
author: Sabrina Y.

description:
NoodleMe is a small noodle shop in the 333 Market Street building but it's actually located on Beale Street near the back of the building.   The place is tiny but they've found a way to spruce up the decor and give it that perfect ramen shop vibe.   The concept is great:  they do noodles your way.  You can get Soba, Rice, Egg or Ramen-type noodles.   You get to customize your toppings.   Clearly they want to give you the "perfect" cup of noodles.

It being my first time here I got overwhelmed and went with one of their Signature Bowls:  I ordered the Buttercup Bowl.  Perhaps that was my mistake.  I didn't make it my true custom cup of noodles.   Still, reading the menu, it sounded right up my alley:  egg noodles, sweet onion mix, prawns, ground pork, spicy tofu, pork broth, habanero flavor and fried shallots.   The only customization I did was to skip the prawns and get an egg instead.   Hell, the server was even so kind as to give me an extra egg!

So why 3 measly stars, you ask?   It was a decent cup of noodles, but it certainly didn't tantalize my taste buds.  I must say the most disappointing part of the meal were the sad and lifeless egg noodles themselves.   They really didn't add anything to the dish.   The pork was rather bland and I'm not sure how that constituted as spicy tofu.   It was tofu, tasting like tofu always does:  nothing.

To recap, service was impeccable and friendly and the concept is great.   I do plan on coming back sometime and perhaps next time I'll truly go 100% custom.  I'll also switch noodles because it might simply be I'm not a huge egg noodle fan.   I'd like to give NoodleMe 4 or 5 stars, but this first meal here left me unimpressed.
author: David O.

description:
I love the create your own noodle bowl concept! There was a little crate with order sheets and pens right outside the door, so it was easy to fill in your order while waiting in line. 

The make-your-own noodle bowl is a good choice-$9 for a yummy lunch.
1) NOODLES: wheat, egg, rice (thick or thin)
2) VEGGIES: herb salad, sweet onion mix, bean sprouts, cabbage & kale, fresh tofu, corn salsa, bamboo shoots, white kimchi, wakame (seaweed), spinach, scallions
3) ADDITIONS: prawns, pork, chicken, spicy beef, egg, spicy tofu, mushrooms, pork shoulder
4) BROTH: both flavor (miso, XO habenero, peanut curry, red curry, lemongrass-ginger) and broth (pork or veggie broth)

My bowl:
- thin rice noodles
- sweet onion mix
- bamboo shoots
- spinach
- egg
- miso pork broth

I got my food fairly quickly. There's a condiment station with different sauces and little containers--there are even small paper bags! I tried the garlic oil, chili oil, furikake and sambal. Noodles and broth are packaged separately, which I appreciate, and broth was still piping hot when I got back to my office. Food was good but the soft-boiled egg was disappointing. $2 for an egg is also a bit of a rip-off, even in downtown SF. 

I'll be back to try more combinations--just without the egg.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Delicious, creative noodle place! You can either build your own noodle bowl or choose from one of their super yummy noodle menu. 

I chose the veganese as it also included curry as an ingredient (trying to go beyond my norm here and didnt want a heavy broth) and it did not disappoint.  Plus they have amazing people working here who are happy to help and give (great) recommendations :) 

A definite must try!!
author: Tasha Y.

description: Noodleme is the "chipotle" of Asian noodles. I've tried their presents and made my own but each time I found the broth too salty or overly rich in a one note kind of way. Even with the vegetarian broth it comes off quite strong which detracts from their noodles and add ons. As for the rest of the meal, they are very generous with their proteins. I usually get chicken although sometimes I indulge in pork. They have an ingenious packaging method that holds your soup separate from the rest of the dish. I do wish though the packaging accommodated the small containers of condiments.
author: Tammy T.

description: I don't know how there's a line for this! For $15, it is by far, the worst noodles I've ever had. It was so bad, that my coworker threw hers away after 2 bites. Literally, cup noodles taste better and is more worth it than this place. First of all, when you get noodle soup, you expect it to be at least warm, if not hot. But when we received it, it was cold! And the flavors were super weird and did not compliment the noodles or the toppings. It was like oily bland water. This was such a disappointment.
author: Chi L.

description:
This place is suddenly super popular at lunch time!

Came here to satisfy my ramen craving, and it was definitely good

Broth: soso kind of plain even with mix ins, because mix ins are done to a plain broth they aren't going to be fully dissolved in

Toppings: the veggies are great! The soft boiled egg was cold and hard boiled which is my pet peeve with ramen. I want to bust the yolk into my soup!

Protein: the pork shoulder comes out great

Noodles: they sell out of most choices before 12, the wheat I got clashed heavily with the soupbut it was the only option

Options: you can do everything from Indian to Thai to Japanese with their options so tons of variety

For $14 and a 20 minute wait I'd want a little more attention to detail and the choices to be there when I order, but other then that it's solid
author: Robin H.

description:
This is noodles just like your momma used to make; a hot bowl of "everything, noodles to pork to corn, tastes just like steamed cardboard."  On top of this magically clean palate, you can make a culinary flavor painting using EITHER of the available sauces - generic hoisin or sriracha!

All this for only $14.
author: Ethan C.

description: Man I was really hoping this place would be good just because it is nearby to my work. However, I was pretty disappointed when I got to dig in. I mean it wasn't bad but it wasn't great. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. Overall, the broth lacked flavor, the chicken was bland, and the noodles were so so. The thing I liked the most was the packaging to go because it made it really easy to carry it back to the office. Honestly I probably would rather go to L&L Hawaiian BBQ to get some Simen because even that had more flavor than what I had gotten. My recommendation is to try one of their creations because maybe mine just sucked.
author: David P.

description:
3.5 stars. I like the idea of this place, especially in FiDi and I am thrilled by the veggie-based options available. I got the veggie broth with wheat noodles, a bunch of veggies and a lemongrass/ginger flavoring. The flavoring tasted too much like Chinese 5 spice rather than the refreshing lemongrass/ginger flavor I was after. Also, on the online ordering menu (Squareup), it doesn't mention that the lemongrass/ginger flavoring has fish sauce in it. However, as I just realized, it says on their main website so if you have any dietary restrictions or allergies, check on their main menu before ordering. 

I would probably come back and try their other options. I like that the noodle bowls can be customized and that there are many healthy toppings. It's definitely a welcome departure from sandwiches and salads.
author: Joan S.

description:
NoodleMe is one of the newer restaurants in the FiDi area but it's made its way onto the list of restaurants I hit up on a bi-weekly basis during my lunch breaks. It's at this sweet point where it's really good but not widely publicized yet, so you can get your food pretty quickly. 

It's a take-out only restaurant specializing in noodle soups. There's quite a few combos to choose from, as they give you choices on broth, noodles, and toppings. My personal approach is to go for the pre-built combos as they all look pretty good and is far easier than building my own soup from scratch. If you have taste buds like mine (I love ramen and pho), you'll love the Five Times Happiness. 

Once you order, you'll get your food about five minutes later with the broth in one bowl and all the noodles and toppings in another. Take it to your lunch place of choice and enjoy!
author: Philip W.

description: This is the chipole of noodles. You choose your noodle, vegetables, broth flavor and extra toppings. There are endless possibilities! I got the wheat noodles with lemongrass ginger broth, added tofu, bamboo shoots and wakame, added the bbq pork shoulder. It was very tasty but I wish that adding meat wasn't as expensive. There's also a condiment bar on the side where you can scoop some garlic oil or hot sauce into little containers. Although there was a line out the door when I went, the employees were very efficient and I got my food quickly.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Glad to see this new place opened close to work. I was hesitant at first, but they were very welcoming.  Love the options that they provide from the choice of rice, egg, and Ramen noodles to the toppings, soup base, and unlimited condiments.

When I  first tried tgeir Buttercup Bowl, I found it a little bland for my taste. But I got another kind of specialty noodles and added some condiments,  which enhanced the taste. 

Their packaging is so nice.  I never have to worry about spilling the soup. Nor do I worry about soggy noidles.  I get to enjoy my warm lunch with al dente noodles and fresh veggies on top.

Yum!
author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.

description:
Pretty good noodles but I wish they had more flavor than they do now. I got the vegetarian broth but it was super salty without much flavor. The noodles themselves were pretty nice and delicious. A lot of healthy ingredients. The price was a little high along with its wait time. I placed my order online but still had to wait about 20 minutes. 

On another occasion I had to wait 30 minutes but It turned out that someone had stolen my noodles!
author: Manpreet S.

description:
My first try of this place and I probably won't come back. I ordered the Gladiator Bowl simply because I love pork shoulder and if they charge 16 dollars for a bowl it should be good.

The pork shoulders were served in cubes and were not tender at all. If the pork shoulder is not tender, it would be wiser to serve them in slices rather than cube. Pork shoulder is one of the toughest cut and requires long cooking time under low heat to tenderize therefore if you don't have the time, may as well take it off the menu. Also they were tasteless so I give pork shoulder a 2 out of 5 (5 being highest).

Other ingredients (minced pork, mushroom, sprout, green onion, etc.) were ok but again the minced pork is overcooked and tough, I guess this is the result of them trying to keep it warm thus overcooking it. I give other ingredients 2 out of 5.

The soup was supposed to be pork broth but I couldn't taste nothing but Miso and salt. I felt thirsty after I finished the bowl, signs of MSG. I give the broth 2 out of 5.

Overall, each ingredient in my noodle soup has its own taste and does not go well together.

However if you are in a hurry and are only up for a quick bite, their service is decently fast however the line builds up after 12:10ish so get there earlier.

16 dollars is just too much and with their location, I bet half of this goes to rent. I don't see this place works out in the long run serving overprice noodles.
author: Jason L.

description: Found this place while looking around for a lunch place. Good thing I found it. They have a few different veg broth options and several different veg ingredients to choose from. Will surely be back to try more
author: Umang D.

description:
Overall: Super tasty, fast, and pretty healthy.  However, after tax and tip, it was $16 for noodles in a city where you get an amazing bowl of noodles for $10 or less.  Will keep it on my lunch rotation for occasional lunches.

Service: Polite and speedy.  They also package up your food in exceptionally well-designed packaging.  Having worked in consumer goods and dealt w packaging, I'm impressed.

Ambiance: This is lunch take out only and that's AOK.

Food: I had the 5 Happiness and subbed in egg noodles for the rice noodles.  It was hearty with a good portion of chicken, tofu, and "herb salad" as well as a soft cooked egg.  The noodles were al dente and the broth was very flavorful.  

Quality/Value: The quality is high, but I still found the prices to be high relative to competitive options.  Also, for those who are particular about their chicken--the chicken seemed to be thighs, which I personally prefer for their flavor, but I know they can be a turn off for some people, especially bc there is some more...chicken/this came from an animal-ness about them.
author: Sara E.

description:
It was delicious!!  Very fresh, satisfying and worth going back to. The condiments are also a huge plus. Next time I would customize my bowl. 

My only complaint is that they gave me the wrong type of noodles. I got rice instead of wheat.
author: Sweta P.

description:
A Chipotle-esqe joint for noodle soup that is strictly grab-and-go since there is not a seat to be found.  Pick your noodles, veggies, broth, flavor then add-on some proteins... or just order a pre-arranged specialty bowl.  And don't overlook all the condiments available for the taking; my favorite is the fried garlic.  Flavor and texture were awesome, but the portion wasn't that filling.  I know it's the FiDi/SoMa area, but $15 still felt a bit pricey for a modest sized grab-and-go soup.

Buttercup Bowl: Lots of flavor going on in this bowl!  A very umami and somewhat spicy broth.  An ample amount of ground pork, also full of flavor.  There were 3 shrimp which were basically unseasoned, but a little broth helps jazz them up.  The tofu was smoked/marinated, making it the tastiest protein.  The egg  noodles were nice and chewy, but felt a little skimpy on the portion.  It felt like they went a bit overboard on the large stalks cuts of scallions.
author: Adam B.

description: Mediocre. The butter cup bowl was so bland. The noodles were thin and didn't absorb the broth flavor. The broth wasn't spicy like I thought it would be. Neither was the tofu. So disappointed. I should've gone somewhere else for lunch.
author: Kaylan W.

description: Love this place.  Fresh, delicious and fast service.  Wish they had a spot in the East Bay.
author: Tim Y.

description: This my go-to place when I'm at work and craving noodles! Although a bit pricey, NoodleMe is always delicious and perfect for a cold/rainy/sick day. My favorite is the buttercup bowl but of course add an egg! They also have different oils that you can add on top (for free) and their packaging makes it easy to carry back to the office!
author: Lauren A.

description:
Great service, food, presentation, and restaurant design! 

We were greeted as soon as we walked through the door and given menus along with an explanation of how to order. You can choose to build your own bowl of soup or order one of the pre-made menu options. Customizing your own bowl is a lot of fun! First you pick a type of noodle, then up to 3 vegetables, meat/other toppings (costs extra), and then finish the bowl with a flavor and broth. Everything is heated up right on the spot and is very fresh. 

All of the employees were extremely helpful and friendly, and the entire experience at the restaurant was really fun (and also quick). I ordered the wheat noodles (ramen) with the miso/pork broth and an egg, and it tasted pretty good. Everything was very flavorful (although also kind of salty). The egg was also pretty runny inside, which was a little disappointing since it cost $2 extra. 

The bowl was packaged quite nicely so that the soup liquid was separate from the vegetables, meats, and other ingredients. This made it easy to transport, since the restaurant itself doesn't have any seating. My only concern is the price - I felt that it was a bit expensive for noodles. This might be due to the fancy packaging, which eventually just gets thrown away anyways. The portion was a good size, and the bowls it can range anywhere from $10-15 depending on if you decide to add meats or other toppings.

Overall, a fun experience and concept! Since there are so few good noodle places in the Financial District, I would probably come back if I was in the mood for noodle soup!
author: Kathy C.

description:
You choose noodles, broth, sauce, 3 veggies, and toppings (extra). Vegetarian option is available. There's a huge lunch rush.

Cons: lukewarm broth, and for a noodle specialty house, the noodles doesn't seem homemade. I tried the XO broth and it was more sweet than spicy. I want to try the lemongrass ginger broth next time.
Pros: convenience, variety of menu items to choose from

Bar sitting available.

I'd go again, but not often.
author: Frannie C.

description:
Reasonably priced if a bit slow lunch spot! Think of it as a chipotle for noodle soups. They have a couple preset bowls you can order or you can create your own. The line can get quite long during lunch so either order ahead so you can do a pick up or come earlier/later than regular lunch hours. After you order your food, it may be another ~15 minutes or so before you're actually able to get it. Also don't forget to get some sauces after you get your food.

As for the noodle soup itself, I found the broth to be lukewarm at best so it didn't really give me the satisfaction of drinking noodle soup on a warm day. It also was a bit too oily so I couldn't finish the broth. The meat + veggies + noodles in the soup were cooked quite well though so I did enjoy that.

Don't make the same mistake as my friend, NoNo actually means No Noodles and is the only dish on the menu without noodles!
author: Cassie Z.

description: It was okay. The food was okay and I feel like you can get better from restaurants around the area especially for the price. I don't think this place will be making it into my standard lunch rotation list.
author: Podar W.

description:
A cool idea on ramen takeout. 

Noodle Me takes the make your own meal idea from Chipotle and applies it to Ramen. Choose your broth, noodles, protein, and veggies and get two containers tied with a nice cardboard holder that perfectly fits a pair of chopsticks. One container is filled with your solid ingredients and the other is filled with your broth. When you're ready to eat, you pour your broth on your solids and enjoy without your noodles and veggies getting soggy. 

The broth is fairly boring and there was a lack of spices in my dishes, but a quick menu upgrade would really make this place stand out as a trendy noodle house. 

A great idea for lunch that could use a menu improvement.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Love this place so much but hate thats it only opens Monday to Friday from like 9-3 and it's not open Saturday or Sunday 
The food is really good but I have to get out of work early to eat there
author: Maria G.

description: I was hesitant at first.. but glad I gave them a try! I was particularly fond of any pre-made noodle options so I customized one :) Egg noodle with miso + pork broth, 1 yummy egg, tofu, mushrooms, and ground pork... SOOO YUMMY!!! I do with it was warmer but we had ordered this for lunch in the office and my meeting ran over so not their fault. Will def order again!
author: J P.

description:
A coworker turned me on to this fantastic noodle place. I saw her unboxing the noodles with the broth on the side, I had to ask where she got it from - noodleme! I went with her the next time she visited and I'm hooked! 

It's a make-your-own-adventure type place and the combinations are endless. I usually get a pork-miso broth with any noodle and onion toppings. There is a sauce bar to the side with little to-go cups for you, which I find hard to carry back since the box wraps around your order with no cubbie hole for extras. 

This is pricey, meat is extra, and my total is usually $15-ish with tip. It's great for those cold and rainy days in the city. 

I will return :)
author: Constance D.

description: Got the veggie toppings noodle soup (in pork broth though). Was good ... but was tasting just a bit too sweet for my taste.
author: Jane J.

description:
Since the closure of Soup Freaks a couple of years ago..the Fidi has been in need of a place like Noodle Me!

I am surprised by some of the negative reviews. I've been here a handful of times. I've stood in line (which moves fast) as well as order ahead. 

My favorite is the vegetable broth in spicy. 

Food is consistently good each time, and the service always very friendly.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I work upstairs in the same building as NoodleMe, so there was no doubt I'd end up trying this place.  I've tried a bunch of different combinations and have found my "regular" bowl.

I LOVE NoodleMe because:
- The flavors are super yummy!!!
- Hello....soft-boiled eggs.
- The dish is very filling.

OK, so it can get a little pricey when you add a bunch of sides....BUT heck, if I can customize and get exactly what I want, I'd gladly pay for it.

There are so many times that I've had my mind set on where to grab lunch, only to find myself changing my mind and picking up NoodleMe instead.  =)
author: B C.

description: First time here and didn't know what to order so just chose the Buttercup Bowl. So good and spicy, just how I like my noodle soup! Full of flavor and very yummy.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Another one of those chipotle style for ramen where you get to customize from your noodle, sides, add ons and broth flavor. I don't get how this is rated so highly. This has to be on of the worse ramen I had and instant ramen would've been more satisfying. 

First off customize your bowl is starting at $9 with no meat, egg or nothing. I ordered the wheat noodle and the description of it was not thick, firm, wavy or fresh. I chose green onions, corn (salsa wtf!), and bamboo. I didn't get any add on bc it should come with it and it's expensive!! Especially for the quality. If I'm paying for this much for ramen I rather go to a place that serve decent bowl of ramen. 

The customer service was great but I would never come back and spend over $10 for a bowl of noodle soup.
author: Sherry Y.

description: Pretty mediocre at best. Ordered online for a 12pm pickup and I was alerted 17 minutes earlier at 11:43am the food was already ready! Came and the staff was nice, but the place was small with little to no seats to sit at. I took my food back to my office to eat with my co-workers. The little take out box is cute in it's own way and the food looked good, but it was not as tasty as I thought it would be! I ordered the Miles Davis which is chicken, pork, noodles, spinach and spicy miso with an egg. The noodles were decent but the "spicy" miso broth wasn't really spicy at all. I added some chili sauce and added some soy sauce to give it some flavor. It turned out better. I will note the egg was fantastic though! I would probably give this spot one more try, but I was a bit disappointed the first time around.
author: James R.

description:
The Chipotle concept is popping up everywhere, but this is the first time I've seen it applied to noodles. This place left me with mixed feelings. I liked what they were trying to do and I can definitely see where they're coming from, but I don't see much value in using this approach with noodles. Noodles are supposed to be cheap, and with the customizations, the price is not worth what you get, in my opinion. I opted to make my own bowl because the set bowls on the menu were like $11-$13. But when I got down to the end of the assembly line, the $2 add-on egg turned my DIY bowl into $12....I mean seriously, $2 for an egg?! So not worth. Portion sizes aren't that big either. I went with the ramen noodles, spicy tofu topping (not that spicy at all), and spinach and bean sprouts for my veggie choices. For soup I chose the pork-based broth and miso flavoring. The flavor was good, but the soup was too salty. 

This place also uses a ton of packaging. Your soup comes in a separate bowl, your noodles/toppings come in its own larger bowl, and both bowls are then packaged together with this fancy cardboard holder thing. Makes it super easy to carry (and they put in the utensils and napkins too), but sigh, sort of unnecessary. So overall, I think this place has a cool concept, but I don't think it's appropriate for noodle soup. Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
I heard about this place from a co-worker so I gave it a try today. Didn't know what to order so I opt for their special they had on display for $11.50.

Everything was lacking seasoning or flavor. The meat was semi cold and the portion I got was half of what they had on display. That's deceptive advertising, you don't get what you see on their display. Pork broth tasted like cheap powered miso mix in a bag with hot water. Pork was not seasoned prior to cooking so it's very bland. At least the noodles and veggies are fresh but with the flavorless broth, it's missing too much to return next time.

Food: 1/5
Price: 2/5
Service:3/5
Cleanliness: 3/5
Recommendation : No
author: Aaron K.

description: The best Ramen! I've been ordering it for the office  and everybody says it's their favorite and keep on asking when we will have it again. The miso soup is so delicious! The eggs are amazing as well!
author: Paulina C.

description:
My absolute go-to for lunch! Love the build-your-own concept. It makes lunch a breeze for a picky eater like me. I always go for pretty much the same bowl:
- Wide noodles
- Tofu
- Herbs
- Spinach
- Peanut beef broth (or sometimes the sesame broth)
- Pork shoulder

Ohhhh that pork is so good! A little fatty so I usually have to do some prep work removing fat before I eat. But it is so so so good! Love how easy it is to carry the noodles back to my office with the little carrier. I've tried to eat in a few times, but it gets jam packed in the tiny restaurant with people waiting for orders and the small standing counters aren't ideal for eating in.

Also love the rewards program -- enter your phone number and receive perks like free protein every few visits. My average order is around $13, so $2 off is great.
author: Chloe M.

description: Very tasty soups and lots of variety. I think it's a bit overpriced but it's well prepared and fast... And I'm sure the rent is steep here. I work in the building so now that I've chatted up the friendly staff about all the options I have to say I prefer to order online so it's ready when I get there. Otherwise there can be a decent line.
author: Alex J.

description:
Vegan and gluten-free options! 

I'm a noodle soup fiend, but being vegan it was tricky to find a fix in the financial district. So glad that noodleme opened up! 

They have a vegetable base stock, and several of their flavorings are vegan (my favorite is the XO Habanero). They even have a delicious vegan kimchi and two kinds of tofu! 

My only complaint would be their online menu doesn't indicate allergens/fish sauce. But their menu in the store clearly indicates which is which, and the employees are all very knowledgeable and friendly. 

A build your own bowl can come to just about $10 if you don't get add-ons/meat, which is about average for the area. And well worth it :)
author: Katelyn P.

description:
Pretty good! Was expecting to be underwhelmed but the ramen was yummy and very filling! I would argue they could have some smaller portions for lunch (i couldn't finish mine). 

Definitely worth a try if you're up for something different than the usual salad :)
author: Laura D.

description:
Ordered the ground pork, rice noodle, pork broth red curry with green onions and kimchee. The ground pork was overly salted and the red curry pork brother was also quite salty with a layer of oil on top. 

The good wasn't that good, but it's convenient. You can order online, pick up asap or schedule a pick up. Once the order is ready, they will text you.
author: Sylvia C.

description: Ok. Wow. Just wow. I am huge fan of this place. I recently discovered I have a wheat allergy, and have gone plant-based, so the vegan/gluten free options are everything I've ever dreamed of. So many veggie options. So much deliciousness. Today I added mushrooms for $2 to my custom bowl and they gave me a very generous helping of them. If you order online for pick up it's ready in 10-15 minutes. The people are nice. The ingredients fresh. Can't really ask for much more. Thank you NoodleMe!
author: Nikki G.

description:
First time trying this place since it opened - I went for the create your own bowl which I got with egg noodles, miso broth, tofu, spinach and onion mix, and added the pork shoulder. I thought the broth was really flavorful, it may be a bit salty for some people but I like my food over seasoned than under seasoned. The pork shoulder was really tender!

Great service. Fast. Convenient (since I work a block away). And great for those cold, rainy days in the city to grab a quick lunch. 

I would come back again!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Gosh I really wish I liked this place. I was so excited to know there's a noodle place nearby. Unfortunately the noodle itself was very disappointing. I got the rice noodle and its a bit hard, not smooth and didnt absorb the soup taste at all. The egg was good though. $2.50 for 3 shrimps seem a little steep.
author: R A.

description:
Interesting concept. I like that I can pick what I want. The food is tasty. The location is convenient for me since I am in the building. 

The only thing is that there are a lot of packaging but I guess because of the priority of keeping the food non-soggy for people who don't work close by. There should be an option of less packaging.
author: Tracy L.

description: This is the 3rd time I've ordered from NoodleMe. My tummy came in hangry, and def left "Happy" after consuming the Five Times Happiness Bowl + Mushrooms! Trust, this place never disappoints!
author: Mona M.

description:
Such a fun place to have in the financial district! Sure there's Sushiritto or Miss Tomato's but sometimes you just want a hot (or cold) bowl of soup. There's an interesting way to how this place works too.

My bowl of choice was the crunchy monkey because if I have warm soup belly, my productivity will most likely decrease after lunch, plus I love cold noodles. My coworkers taught me an important lesson, always go with the signature bowls when trying out a new spot because they know what goes together. I made that mistake the first time but was still happy with my bowl since I like to think that I have a good palate. 

I have to say that it is a little pricey BUT you get a good amount of food. Not everyone in the Financial district is making financial district moola so this would go in my list of "lunch treats every now and then" along with the Ramen Bar. If I was in the area, I'd easily swoop by to Noodleme and my friends.
author: Dor H.

description:
I AM DEFINITELY A FAN FOR SURE!  Love the ease of ordering ahead, no non-sense menu, love the fact it's soft boiled egg - prices very reasonable for downtown SF FiDi - all Ramen places you do pay for extra toppings/meat etc. so I don't understand the complaint of this in some of the reviews.

Good quality noodles/sides/meat.  Friendly/fast service.  As a matter of fact, I prefer the to eat  here compared to The Ramen Bar by Michael Mina.  It tastes more authentic to me.
author: Grace D.

description: Nope. No good. Also I can't say it's authentic cause I can't tell if it's Vietnamese / Japanese? Worst part is the broth. And the broth is most important part. Bland. Perhaps lacks some good ol MSG.
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description: Awesome food and fast! Great in the winter for the warm soup and they have non-soup noodles for the summer. They are very friendly and one of the owners is always there greeting you. I work close by and end up coming here at least a couple times a week.
author: Sunyo S.

description:
Excellent (regular but well prepared) broth and wheat noodles!

The place lets you mix and match the ingredients they have, which is even better than their preset combos.
author: Sundaram R.

description: Lovely food. No place for dine in but great food for take out. Mobile app purchase is on time.
author: K K.

description:
First time trying NoodleMe. It's been slightly chilly so felt like a soup today. 

As other Yelpers mention it's a chipotle concept style noodle soup take out joint with a few bowls that are already suggested to help those that are too overwhelmed by all the choices.  I am one of those people as it took me a hour to even leave the office to find food.  Anyways ordered the Buttercup bowl as the spicy really sounded good to me.  From ordering to getting my order was 8 minutes so I was pleased considering I read another review where it took 30min?!?  

Got my bowl back to the office and thought the broth was pretty tasty and spicy - lots of tofu, pork and 3 shrimps.  The soup came with egg noodles and I guess in my mind I had a diff kind of egg noodle I was expecting so a little disappointed there. Also I thought the amount of noodles was a little on the slim side considering my bowl costs $14 or $16 with tax. One thing to note about the broth was it was really oily because of the hot chillie oil.  I normally don't like those kinds of soups because it's just too much oil. You know what I mean.  

Overall I'm pretty satisfied with my lunch - would have been happier with more noodles (come on they are so cheap!) and probably would have given this place 4 stars if there was more of them. The cost couldn't justify how little noodles are.
author: Julie F.

description: Love the ability to customize my noodles. Servers were very friendly. Only caveat is that the space is small, be prepared to take your order to go or share the table (really closely) with another hungry stranger!
author: Earl J.

description:
This place surprised me. As other have said it falls along the chiptole concept where your meal is customizable. So many options- maybe not so great if you're indecisive. :) 

My friend and I decided to give this place a try when we were looking for a ramen place in the area. 
Here's how it works:

1.  You get to choose from 3 different types of noodles (wheat noodles- similar to ramen, rice noodles- similar to pho [and gluten free!], and egg noodles- similar to wonton/chinese noodles)
2.  Then you get to choose 3 types of veggies/ herbs that go in your noodle bowl. You can choose from an assortment of either veggies, tofu, onions or cilantro/ other herb mixes. 
3.  The next step is to choose your protein. They offer soft boiled egg, spicy tofu, pork, prawn, chicken, meatball and mushroom. 
4.  Then you choose your flavorings and broth. Their are two options of broth either vegetarian or meat (mushroom or pork&chicken. Flavorings include: miso, red curry, xo habenero, peanut curry and lemongrass-ginger. 

I ordered my noodle bowl with rice noodles, spinach, cilantro/basil mix, and their sweet onion mix. Then I opted for a soft boiled egg along with the spicy tofu. For flavoring I got their mushroom broth with their xo habenero flavoring and umami. Overall it was delicious. Although there was too much herbs/ onions in my soup for my liking. The soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly but the spicy tofu was not spicy at all. The habanero broth was super flavorful and definitely has a good kick! (Pro tip! Don't be afraid to ask for a sample. I was curious to know how the habanero flavoring tasted like and I asked them if I could sample it and they were super nice about it! ) 

Since there are so many options, ask questions and ask for samples! The customer service is great. 

Also this is a TO-GO place only. BE ADVISED they have no seating inside. 

This place is definitely the new kid on the block! Give it a try before the hype catches up!
author: Sam L.

description:
I never write reviews but I think I want to share my experience here.

30+ minutes to get a bowl of soup.. seriously?

Yes, I should have been warned by the line outside, but other places with a long line go MUCH faster. I figured this was a concept similar to eatsa so I wasn't going to be phased by the line but I was very wrong.

Ok so the food must be delicious? Nope. It wasn't bad by any means but just completely "MEH". Apart from being super salty, I can't recall anything that was particularly tasty in this soup (Got the ramen style noodle with miso broth).

And the price.. $9.74 with tax for the most basic noodle soup? I'm no stranger to FiDi prices as I eat out every single day. But this was really not worth the price or wait.

Also the packaging is super wasteful and so is using a piece of paper for every single customer's order. It's 2016 folks.. A little bit of environmental consciousness would be nice!
author: Alexandre T.

description:
Super quick and tasty lunch spot, reasonably priced!

I ordered a custom bowl with: 
- Fresh rice noodles (delicious, wide, pad see ew style noodles)
- Veggie Broth
- Miso + Sesame flavor
- w/ toasted sesame tofu, scallions and white kimchee
- (Key! Added the "salsa" from the condiment bar) 

Cute space, cute packaging, fun condiments to try, and the perfect meal for a cold rainy day. Oh, also they separate your broth and noodles, so you don't have to worry about them getting overcooked or soggy before you eat them! Good thinking NoodleMe. 

I'd definitely go back.
author: Dimple B.

description: Terrible service and overpriced. They have an online ordering system who's pickup time is never accurate. I still spend 20 min waiting once I get there after the pickup time. It's disorganized and inefficient. Food is good but not for the price and quality of service. I won't eat there again and will not recommend.
author: Jose M.

description: Riding the food trend of "mix your own bowl" amongst others such as poke bowl, Indian curry bowl, Vietnamese bowl, etc. NoodleMe's concept is yet another foodie destination for those who are adventurous (because you are never really sure about what your mixed noodle would taste like). Definitely love the freedom of mixing with whatever I like, but it does require trial and error to come up with the perfect taste!
author: Nina T.

description: I enjoyed some of the combos were for appealing to my taste buds, but the team was able to make accommodations for my special request.
author: P W.

description: Awesome lunch place! Loved the packaging and being able to create your own noodles. The only thing is we found a pice of egg shell when we brought it back to the office. Considering its a $2 add on, not good! Overall though, very yummy :)
author: Susan P.

description:
The place was clean, people were friendly, the food was good, came out fast.
A lot of condiments, decent prices and I was full after.
author: rich n.

description: What a great spot!  Best Ramen I have found downtown!  Also great staff and really efficient service even with a long line. Must try one of their composed bowls although build your own was temping with all those great ingredients!
author: Obie O.

description: Best Ramen I have ever had. The noodles were full of flavor and the broth was amazing. Very well made, fresh produce, and great portions. Very nice staff!
author: Tori S.

description:
LOVE the concept of this lunch spot! It's basically a choose your own adventure for noodle fans. I'm still dreaming about the bowl I had for lunch yesterday. Broth flavors are off the charts, eggs are cooked to perfection, and protein/topping options are endless. Can't forget to mention the packaging - GENIUS! 

Now I just need to get in contact with our office manager to have her order catering for our next meeting....or every meeting for that matter....
author: Tricia J.

description:
After months of expectation, NoodleMe finally opened up downstairs yesterday. I went in today after the general lunch mob and I was greeted at the door with a menu. Once inside, the place smelled exactly like I expected it to, a good sign of what was to come. This is basically a build-your-own ramen bowl, or you have the option to select from one of a few pre-configured bowls. I chose to go with the latter and order the Miles Davis bowl containing wheat noodles, veggies, a nice mix of proteins, in a pork broth. I was intrigued by the process for building. I just finished eating my bowl and it was quite tasty! I would have liked a little more spice, but that was my fault for not stopping by the condiments bar before leaving. Or maybe they could have reminded me of that?

The packaging process is impressive, but I felt a little excessive. I understand to keep things fresh, but it was just so much to be thrown away. They might consider asking how soon the food will be eaten and package accordingly. Maybe that takes too long? I don't know, I've never ran a food business so I am sure I am missing something important. 

The bowls are priced kinda high, a little higher than Ramen Bar around the corner. Granted, NoodleMe had more protein (chicken, ground pork, and egg) than anything I have gotten at Ramen Bar, but I might be ok with that at Ramen Bar considering they have seating options. 

The staff was nice, although obviously a little slow from getting used to everything happening around them. Maybe not enough prep/ training before opening. I expect this to get better though with time. 

So, 1 star down for packaging and price. Otherwise I am happy this place is here. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Gerard C.

description: Great new space on Beale street....neat, clean and very appealing space.  Great menu and the staff was eager to explain to me.  In detail.  I chose the Miles-Davis signature noodle bowl...with ground pork, soft boiled egg and a miso/mild spicy broth.  Tasty.  I will be back.  well done!
author: James A.

description:
I don't usually do well at places where I "have" to customize my own meal: too picky for the suggested combos and not creative enough to blend custom flavor selections. I must have lucked out building my own bowl today! Soup was full of flavor, no need to add soy sauce or chili paste (I use spice to make up for flavor or not enough salt), good proportion of noodles to toppings. Portion was perfect for lunch (I can't typically finish a medium bowl or ramen or pho)

$14.change for wheat ramen-style noodles ($9 base), chicken and soft-boiled egg (+$2 each), the sweet onion mix, soy sauce bamboo and carrots, bok choy/Napa cabbage mix, with miso flavor and pork broth.
author: Bliss C A.

description:
Went yesterday and will be going back for lunch very often! The 3 noodle choices all looked fantastic and the optional spices for those that like, were very much appreciated.
The broth base tasted great and they even offered different flavors.
author: Pedro S.

description: It was very tasty and delicious. I had the build your own bowl with the pork broth with the lemongrass flavor. I liked how the 'flavor' options gave an extra depth to the broth. I wished it was a little more warm but it could be that I ate it after walking a few blocks. It was opening week and the staff was very hospitable and welcoming. A great lunch option especially if you don't have much time and want something warm and soupy.
author: Tina L.

description: NoodleMe is such a welcome addition to the FiDi lunch scene!  The quality of the ingredients is top notch and the staff is super helpful.  You can create a customized noodle soup or salad, or you can choose from the menu of noodle bowls. It's the perfect mix of build-your-own bowl or chef-inspired creations.  It's delicious, fresh and efficient.  Stop by NoodleMe for a tasty, unique, and super-scrumptious lunch.
author: Jamie D.

description: My new lunch addiction! This place is great. Fresh noodles and ingredients and you can either build your own bowl or have one of their specialties. (My favorite is the buttercup bowl) The staff are also extremely pleasant which seems to be rare in the FiDi. I just wish they had one a bit closer to my office but the online ordering option is nice.
author: Mark S.

description:
Friggin great food!  My fiancé and I grabbed take out lunch here today and were blown away at the quality, service, and price.  

Having such a great menu of build-it-your-own ingredients, and a nice menu of specialty bowls makes for an interesting and widely varied lunch option!  

Also the packaging makes for a great take out option!
author: Kyle W.

description: Good idea ruined by overpricing... $15 bowl was small and needed alot more everything. I am used to ramen shops in San Mateo etc....put this place to bed. Santa Ramen or any others much better price...size...quality.
author: Larry D.

description: Overall I was impressed with my noodle soup here. Ordered the veganese soup with the mushroom broth and I really enjoyed all the flavors, including the tofu and shiitake mushrooms. I thought everything tasted really fresh. I saw a lot of complaints about the packaging, but i thought it was rather clever - the broth is separate from the noodles and other fillings because the container is compostable and gets soggy with the broth, and they keep it all together with a cardboard holder. My only complaint is the price of course, but it is within range for most lunch places. Noodleme replaced a Japanese spot that went out of business, I have my fingers crossed that it hangs around for awhile!
author: Asha R.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the food here!   I customized my noodle bowl and so did my friend and then we took our meal and sat outside in the 333 Market Plaza on a beautiful Tuesday afternoon and enjoyed.  I liked that we add our own broth so you can fill your container of noodles and ingredients with as much broth as you like.  Then enjoy.  It was really good!  I'll be back.
author: Carol S.

description: I'm always looking for good lunch spots and when I discovered NoodleMe it was love at first sight. I've since become a regular. By no means is it a traditional noodle house. Their specialty bowls pull influences from dishes all over Asia; from Thai boat noodles to Japanese somen salads. I recommend giving them a try.
author: Rudy B.

description:
True comfort food on a cloudy day. 

I made my own bowl: ramen noodles; herb salad; spinach; bean sprouts; spicy tofu; and mushroom broth with lemongrass-ginger flavoring. It was soooooo good. Lots of flavor and everything complimented each other. 

It was a cooler day so the warmth of the broth was comforting, but I don't think one should wait for a cold day to experience it. 

Tip: Ordering online for pickup is handy as there is usually a line.
author: Robyn M.

description: I pre ordered 5 bowls through their website for my staff and I. Everything was absolutely Perfect! It was so fitting for this rainy day. We ordered a few of their Specialty bowls and built some custom bowls. Not a thing was missed and it was a great price for the portion. I highly recommend NoodleMe I will absolutely be ordering again soon. Thanks Guys!
author: Julie S.

description:
Hmmm, for just a bowl of noodle and soup for $12-$15 is a bit much even in Fidi.  It's good, clean and nice, but in my opinion you can get similar bowl of noodle soup close by for less than $10.

Probably won't be back.........
author: Val S.

description: Very Clean place.  Nice packaging, presentation.  A bit on the pricey side, 12 bucks for soup seems a bit much.  I am from San Jose so I might be more used to paying for less.  I might be back, just thought for the price you should of received more.
author: Jimmy P.

description: Waited a long time for NoodleMe to open and it was worth the wait.  Friendly, helpful staff, tasty food. I customized my bowl and it was very good.  I just need to remember to hit the condiment bar for some hot sauce on my way out next time. A little pricey, but it is SF and you have to expect that. I will be back! :)
author: L K.

description: Loved it, cool concept and well done for their first week. Easy to get in and out with fresh ingredients. I really liked my lunch and love the spice in their curry broth. I'd recommend.
author: S L.

description: NoodleMe tries to be like the Chipotle for noodle soup but misses the mark. Sometimes picking and choosing ingredients does not work for all types of food - this being one of them. The taste was subpar and for $13-15 a bowl (depending on what extras you choose), I'd rather go to Ramen Bar for a more consistent, superior noodle soup. Plus the packaging is way overdone and drinking the broth from the bowl is a futile process. Hope they turn this around but until they do, I won't be coming back.
author: Arthur N.

description: Great service, friendly helpful staff, and awesome noodles! Cant wait to go back here. Yum!
author: Erica K.

description: Seriously worst meal have had in along time.  Bland food and way over packaged. I had one meal and had a pile of plastic leftover. Will not go back for that reason alone. Felt silly walking back to the office with all the containers they gave me for a very small amount of food.
author: Natalie S.

description: Very delicious food!  Quality ingredients. Quick turnaround.  A bit pricey, but that's expected in SF.  Chill atmosphere and staff.  Totally recommended!
author: Ryan U.

description: Nice concept. The food was fresh. Wait was not to long.
author: Dave K.

description: I decided to check this place out after walking  by it l.  I ordered egg noodle,cabbage medley,herb salad(Thai basil,cilantro,scallion) Miso soup for the broth and Char Siu which is braised pork shoulder this was the biggest turn off (3) small pieces for $2.50 with 2 of them being all fat. If they used Char Siu like you find in China Town or Clement St. the one you see hanging from a hook it would've been more appetizing.  This pork shoulder was cooked in a broth like Adobo. They also offer different  types of sauces which really enhanced the  dish  I had the basic chili sauce, garlic sauce, scallion.  Its a little expensive ($14.00 for Ramen) .
author: Shari K.

description: I tried noodle me today thinking its a healthier option with noodles but I felt totally disappointed. I am a vegetarian so I chose build your own bowl option. I tried wheat noodles which were very greasy. They added very less quantity of all the vegetables which I asked to add which basically meant I just had noodles in my bowl. Thats why I asked them to add spicy tofu. I regretted my decision as the tofu was so much salty I could not eat. Also they charged 1.50 for the tofu which made my bowl cost $11.50. The broth Xo Habanero and mushroom was again so much salty that the total bowl saltiness got doubled. I through away the food after having some as I was not able to eat at all. I was feeling very frustrated to throw $11+ doller food. I am not sure how they are serving such food that too at so much high cost. There are so many nice options available just across the street which are lot healthier tastier and comes for around half of the price. Strict no go for me for the next time.
author: Shraddha A.
